about_the_game:
The Comeback Kingdom is a captivating blend of turn-based strategy, role-playing, and comedy. Step into a fantasy world where you are tasked with saving a kingdom in its time of need.

Key Features:

1. Intuitive Strategy Gameplay:

  • Combat: Easy to understand turn-based combat.

  • Strategy: Just mashing attack won't cut it. To deal massive damage you must utilize your magic and skills.

  • Exploration: Locations are easy to navigate and reward the player with valuable loot if they are willing to explore.

2. Engaging Role-Playing Elements:

  • Character Development: The hero and his companions experience tons of character growth along the journey.

  • Story-Driven Quests: Immerse yourself in a hilarious yet compelling storyline.

  • Cutscenes: In between combat you will be treated to many cutscenes that are both entertaining and crucial to the plot.

3. Immersive World:

  • Rich Lore: Discover the history and lore of a world filled with magic, mystery, and intrigue.

  • Varied Environments: Travel the kingdom to experience a multiple of diverse locations.

  • Mystery: Discover who or what is responsible for the turmoil your kingdom is under.

4. Replayability:

  • Second Playthrough: Read more into what the characters say on your second playthrough, now that you know the plot twist.

  • Built in Speedrun Challenge: Test your speed running abilities by choosing the speedrun option at the beginning. Five secret fast travel shortcuts are hidden in this mode to aid your record.

Additional Information:

Platforms: PC Genre: Strategy, RPG Developer: Byzantium Games Publisher: Byzantium Games Release Date: 10/21/24

The fate of the kingdom is in your hands. Will you restore it to its former glory or watch it crumble under the weight of your decisions? The choice is yours in The Comeback Kingdom.

content_descriptors.notes:
The game includes adult language.
The game includes several characters that drink alcohol.
The game has NO nudity.
The violence in the game isn't very graphic.
The goblins in this video game act similar to how they act in the anime "Goblin Slayer". Which if you haven't seen that anime, means the goblins try to commit SA. However, unlike episode 1 of "Goblin Slayer", the goblins in this game do not successfully commit SA on any of the characters.
